message: شباب Intel قفلت فرعها فى مصر

data.message: اكيد النور كان بيقطع  وهم شغالين =D =D =D .
Intel اظن بتقفل مكاتب كتير فى العالم مش مصر بس

أنتو لسة شوفتو حاجة :)
كل مؤسسات الstartup projects موقفة نشاطها فى مصر برضه

Ahmad Abd-Elghany haha, not really. "Startup projects" require some explanation and what exactly are we talking about in terms of organizations empowering startups.

Accelerators, VCs, Incubators, Summits/Conferences, Co-working locations? Educational bodies like Injaz or startup competitions like Startup battle Egypt which we sponsored last year along with the 5-6 other Startup weekends that took place underneath it? 
Name one whose operations are on hold. Hence, my request for an explanation ;)

cc: Moutaz Hodhod

Hady Ahmed  this local initiatives are totally cool but there is no big boys stuff here.
What do you do to get 1 million USD for tech startup in Egypt as a fund?
It is shitty and I don't think it will get any better soon, You can have better chances raising fund in Dubai more than here.
Here most investors are coming from the background of brokerage and real estate, looking at the last 10 years, how many industrial entrepreneur had his business running in Egypt and how many are willing to put money in this new thing called tech
on the other hand most Gulf countries use international consultancy offices which technically not as good as the real investors but with the guidance they have they can make some use for their money

I think this is what meant when he said Startup activities are sort of on hold in Egypt.

don't consider events and summit as big thing, it is educational thingy, it is all part of infrastructure.

The real deal is people who put money and it is clear that it is not easy to get anyone put money now.
For Intel office I think the office is not beneficial for them, if they care for the people they would take them to any other office.

Ahmed We've been in the same sinking ship for long enough to know better and you know my stance about the shit hole we're in, wont reiterate over it again, a topic for another day.

My objection was the stark statement which is _literal_ in nature. No one put their operations on halt, except maybe Tahrirsq slowed their pace significantly. 
Is everything at ground halt? No. Is it good enough? No but that's irrelevant to the subject matter being discussed now.

I see no problem in Intel closing its offices either, it's a business decision. Call it as you may, bubble or anticipated economic collapse. This trend of optimizing business operations has been going on since 2012.
It's hitting everyone.
